title: Bug 12398: Accessibility problems
description: When using the application, I noticed that I need to first click on one of the interactive areas (such as the banner with the tool buttons, the navigation frame, or the content frame) before they become responsive. This is an accessibility issue that needs to be addressed.
OB: When I first open the application, the interactive areas are not immediately responsive to keyboard navigation. I have to click on them before they start working correctly.
EB: We should ensure that the Help view is accessible and can be navigated via the keyboard right from the start, without needing to click on any specific areas.
SR:
To reproduce this issue:
1. Open the application.
2. Attempt to navigate through the Help view using only the keyboard.
3. Observe that the interactive areas are not immediately responsive.
4. Click on one of the interactive areas (e.g., the banner with the tool buttons, the navigation frame, or the content frame).
5. Observe that the interactive areas become responsive to keyboard navigation after clicking on them.
